theme: Bar staff upsell + local promos on slow nights

avatar_style.persona: Authentic, savvy bartender (late 20s/early 30s) who's good at their job and has found a clever workflow hack. Not an influencer, just a real person.
avatar_style.wardrobe: Dark t-shirt with a subtle, non-descript bar logo or just a plain black tee. Maybe a half-apron.
avatar_style.setting: A slightly dimly lit, cozy-looking bar during pre-opening hours. The focus is on the host, with the bar environment visible but not distracting.

script.speaker: host
script.line: Slow night at the bar? That TV in the corner is my secret weapon.
script.broll_cue: Quick shot of a blank or underutilized TV in a bar corner, then cut back to host.

script.speaker: host
script.line: We use it to push our own specials—like tonight's rotating tap or our late-night happy hour.
script.broll_cue: Phone screen showing a 'Bar Specials' template. Then, shot of the TV displaying a 'Craft Beer Special' card.

script.speaker: host
script.line: It’s just an app, Trillboards. I connected this TV by scanning a QR code on a website. Takes like 30 seconds.
script.broll_cue: Close-up of phone scanning a QR code displayed on the TV screen (screen.trillboards.com).

script.speaker: host
script.line: I picked a playlist, set it to rotate, and now it just runs itself. I can swap out a special from my phone anytime.
script.broll_cue: Screen recording of dragging/dropping a new 'card' into a playlist on the Trillboards app.

script.speaker: host
script.line: Here's the side-hustle part: you can add a couple of paid local promos. We've got one for the tattoo parlor down the street. It can bring in an extra $10, maybe $40 a day.
script.broll_cue: TV shows a local promo card. Small, subtle cash icon animation appears on screen.

script.speaker: host
script.line: Just make sure you get your manager's okay, and don't run promos that compete with the bar.
script.broll_cue: Host gives a serious, direct-to-camera look, maybe a thumbs-up gesture.

script.speaker: host
script.line: It's a simple way to make a dead screen useful and earn a little extra. Worth a look.
script.broll_cue: Host leans on the bar, smiling, with the TV rotating specials in the background.

caption_overlay.text: Slow night at the bar? That TV in the corner is my secret weapon.
We use it to push our own specials—like tonight's rotating tap or our late-night happy hour.
It’s just an app, Trillboards. I connected this TV by scanning a QR code on a website. Takes like 30 seconds.
I picked a playlist, set it to rotate, and now it just runs itself. I can swap out a special from my phone anytime.
Here's the side-hustle part: you can add a couple of paid local promos... It can bring in an extra $10, maybe $40 a day.
Just make sure you get your manager's okay, and don't run promos that compete with the bar.
It's a simple way to make a dead screen useful and earn a little extra. Worth a look.

primary: Close-up of phone showing Trillboards app interface
The bar's TV screen displaying rotating cards (specials and local promos)
secondary: Empty or near-empty bar environment to establish 'slow night'
Close up of a drink being poured to reinforce the bar setting

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Scan QR code at screen.trillboards.com with phone
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Instantly connects any TV without needing hardware or IT help.
Gets relevant content live in seconds, no design skill needed.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Add an optional paid promo from the marketplace
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Creates a small, passive income stream for the staff/venue.

constraints_and_risks: MUST get permission from the bar owner or manager before setting up.
Earnings are variable and depend on foot traffic, location, and advertiser demand; the $10-40 range is an estimate, not a guarantee.
Only choose local promos that are a good fit for the venue and don't compete (e.g., a concert, a local clothing store, not another bar).

metrics_hypothesis.shareability_notes: Highly shareable among service industry workers (bartenders, servers, managers) in group chats or on niche forums. The 'side-hustle' angle combined with a practical work tool is compelling for this audience.

alt_hooks: Your bar has a TV like this, right? Here's how to make it actually earn its keep.
Here's a side hustle for bartenders that your manager will actually love.

rights_and_clearance_notes: Requires a location release from the bar owner. Any patrons in the background must be blurred or provide consent. Any music used must be licensed for commercial use. The bar's main logo should be avoided unless cleared.
